thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger can’t leave yet says Martin Keown | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger can’t leave yet says Martin Keown | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger can’t leave yet says Martin Keown | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Sunday 12 Feb 2017 1:59 pm Arsene Wenger has not revealed his intentions for his future (Getty) 
Martin Keown believes it’s too soon for Arsene Wenger to leave Arsenal . 
There is growing speculation that the Frenchman will call time on his tenure in north London after 21 years with the club. He will be out of contract in the summer and has been coy on whether he will sign a new deal. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
There is even talk that the Arsenal hierarchy are lining up potential replacements. 
Former Arsenal defender Keown is hopeful Wenger will remain a little long though, believing the club is not yet prepared for him to go. 
‘I do feel if he were to go now without any succession plan management from the club it would be too soon,’ he told the BBC. ‘I don’t think the board are yet ready, or this club is ready for him to leave. There’s a lot of thinking that needs to be done at a high level. Wenger watched his side win 2-0 on Saturday (Getty) 
‘Yes, the end is coming. But maybe another contract of one year, or two years. And he, Wenger, should be made to be a part of the management structure that comes in. Somebody in the same mould.’
